review.title: Gromov-Hausdorff stability of linkage-based hierarchical clustering methods
review.abstract: A hierarchical clustering method is stable if small perturbations on the data set produce small perturbations in the result. These perturbations are measured using the Gromov-Hausdorff metric. We study the problem of stability on linkage-based hierarchical clustering methods. We obtain that, under some basic conditions, standard linkage-based methods are semi-stable. This means that they are stable if the input data is close enough to an ultrametric space. We prove that, apart from exotic examples, introducing any unchaining condition in the algorithm always produces unstable methods.

sections.text: These perturbations are measured using the Gromov-Hausdorff method and extensive analyses are applied. We investigate the problem of stability based on hierarchical clustering methods. Apart from exotic examples, we can state that the introduction of unchaining condition into the algorithm always produces unstable methods, which means that they are stable when the input data is close enough to an ultrametric space. We prove that, apart from exotic examples, the introduction of unchaining condition into the algorithm always produces unstable methods.
